WizardAnswered on 18 May 2019I believe that a minimum income of $30,000 per year is required to apply for a basic credit card in Singapore, and that could be higher if you are a foreigner. I do think you would need to wait 3 months first, because chances are that the credit card application would get rejected and you would need to re-apply again when you have 3 months of salary to show.0 comments2

Because on their end they gotta make sure your salary is consistent and stable.
